      • setLanguageSubstitute

        public void setLanguageSubstitute(boolean bSubstitute)
        Description copied from interface: LanguageHandlerInterface
        Sets whether getLanguageString tries to find a language item on another language if it is not exists in the current language
        Specified by:
        setLanguageSubstitute in interface LanguageHandlerInterface
        Parameters:
        bSubstitute - true when getLanguageString should try to find a language item on another language if it is not exists in the current language false when getLanguageString searches a language item only in the current language

      • isLanguageSubstitute

        public boolean isLanguageSubstitute()
        Description copied from interface: LanguageHandlerInterface
        Returns whether getLanguageString tries to find a language item on another language if it is not exists in the current language
        Specified by:
        isLanguageSubstitute in interface LanguageHandlerInterface
        Returns:
        the language substitution state

        public boolean addLanguage(String sLanguage)
        Description copied from interface: LanguageHandlerInterface
        Adds a language denoted by a name or code (eg. "hungarian" or "hu", "english" or "en", etc.)
        Specified by:
        addLanguage in interface LanguageHandlerInterface
        Parameters:
        sLanguage - the name or code of a language
        Returns:
        true if the added language is a new one, false otherwise

        Returns:
        the currently selected language name or code (empty string if not yet set)

      • setEnabledLanguages

        public void setEnabledLanguages(String sEnabledLanguages)
        Description copied from interface: LanguageHandlerInterface
        Sets the enabled languages. When it is set, getAvailableLanguages returns all added languages, except those ones that set by setEnabledLanguages

        When it is set to an empty string, all available languages are enabled.

        Specified by:
        setEnabledLanguages in interface LanguageHandlerInterface
        Parameters:
        sEnabledLanguages - enabled language names or codes separated by commas, pipes, or something non-letter character

      • getAvailableLanguages

        public Vector<String> getAvailableLanguages()
        Description copied from interface: LanguageHandlerInterface
        Returns available language names or codes, except those ones that set by setEnabledLanguages
        Specified by:
        getAvailableLanguages in interface LanguageHandlerInterface
        Returns:
        a java.util.Vector of String of available languages names or codes.
